Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements

Class WindowsElement

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.Element
com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.WindowsElement
public class WindowsElement extends Element
WinAppDriver implementation of a Element.

  • Constructor Details

    • WindowsElement

      public WindowsElement(String elementName, Map<String,String> selectors)
      Default Windows Element constructor. An override of the Element constructor.
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the name of the element
      selectors - Map<String,String> the list of selectors to use to find the element

  • Method Details

    • element

      protected org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element()
      Returns the Selenium WebElement if it can be found on the current page. Provides late binding for elements so that the driver does not look for them until they are called, at which point the driver should be on the correct page.
      Overrides:
      element in class Element
      Returns:
      org.openqa.selenium.WebElement the Selenium WebElement object type that can be acted upon

    • createByLocator

      protected org.openqa.selenium.By createByLocator(SelectorType selectorType, String selectorValue)
      Takes a Sentinel SelectorType and string value and returns a Selenium By locator specifically for Windows elements.

      NOTE: TagName (LocalizedControlType) is unsupported at this time for windows element identification. This seems to be an appium issue.

      Overrides:
      createByLocator in class Element
      Parameters:
      selectorType - SelectorType the ENUM value indicating how we search for the element
      selectorValue - String the value being pulled from the config file for the selector
      Returns:
      org.openqa.selenium.By returns a Selenium By selector for locating an element.

    • sendKeys

      public Element sendKeys(String text)
      Enter text into a Element. Typically used for text boxes. This method will throw an ElementDisabledException() if the text box is disabled.
      Overrides:
      sendKeys in class Element
      Parameters:
      text - String the text to enter
      Returns:
      Element (for chaining)

    • getText

      public String getText()
      Returns the text of the page element as a String.
      Overrides:
      getText in class Element
      Returns:
      String the text value stored in the element

    • clear

      public Element clear()
      Clear an Element. Clears text in a text box. If the call to selenium's clear() fails to actually remove text, this method will send CTRL+A + BACKSPACE key chord to attempt to clear the element text.
      Overrides:
      clear in class Element
      Returns:
      Element (for chaining)

    • click

      public Element click()
      Click an Element.
      Overrides:
      click in class Element
      Returns:
      Element (for chaining)

    • getColorAtOffset

      public org.openqa.selenium.support.Color getColorAtOffset(int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Returns the Color of the pixel at the given xOffset, yOffset relative to the top left pixel of the element. WARNING!!! Windows (OS) setting "Make everything bigger" (app and text scaling) must be set to 100% for proper use of this method.
      Parameters:
      xOffset - int the pixels to the right of the left edge of the element
      yOffset - int the pixels below the top edge of the element
      Returns:
      Color the color at the specified pixel offset in the element.

    • getColorAtOffset

      public org.openqa.selenium.support.Color getColorAtOffset()
      Returns the Color of the pixel one below and one to the right of the top left pixel of the element. WARNING!!! Windows (OS) setting "Make everything bigger" (app and text scaling) must be set to 100% for proper use of this method.
      Returns:
      Color the color of the pixel one below and one to the right of the top left pixel of the element.

    • attributeEquals

      public boolean attributeEquals(String attribute, String value)
      Returns true if the element has an attribute equal to the value passed; otherwise returns false. For Windows elements, if attribute == "color" the color is checked via screenshot analysis. Otherwise attribute is checked by grabbing attribute off the element.

      Examples:

      • Determine if an element has a style="display:none" attribute set.
      Overrides:
      attributeEquals in class Element
      Parameters:
      attribute - String the attribute to look for
      value - String the value to which attribute should be checked against
      Returns:
      boolean true if the element as an attribute equal to the value passed; otherwise returns false

    • getBackgroundColor

      public Color getBackgroundColor()
      Windows does not support color information, as such this is an unsupported operation for windows elements.
      Overrides:
      getBackgroundColor in class Element
      Returns:
      Color Java color object of the background color of the element

    • getScreenshot

      public File getScreenshot()
      Returns a screenshot File of the current element.
      Overrides:
      getScreenshot in class Element
      Returns:
      File a screenshot of the current element

    • screenshotElement

      private BufferedImage screenshotElement()
      Returns a BufferedImage taken of the current element
      Returns:
      BufferedImage A robot screenshot cropped to the current element
